docs.lead_paragraph: A school district in Utah has suspended two people and opened an investigation after lunchroom workers touched off a furor by snatching food trays from several dozen children whose parents were behind on meal payments, a district spokesman said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pre-K funding should include money to study what actually works.

headline.main: How to Get More Early Bloomers
headline.print_headline: How to Get More Early Bloomers

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Professors Daniel T Willingham and David W Grissmer submits that funding for universal preschool proposed by New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and Pres Obama should also subsidize large-scale study to evaluate what is beneficial; holds it is difficult to evaluate outcome of large state preschool programs and that current data is inadequate.
docs.snippet: Pre-K funding should include money to study what actually works.

byline.original: By DANIEL T. WILLINGHAM and DAVID W. GRISSMER

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts say the results of a major new study may reshape approaches to combating the nation’s obesity epidemic, suggesting that efforts must start much earlier and focus more on the children at greatest risk.

headline.main: Obesity Is Found to Gain Its Hold in Earliest Years
headline.print_headline: Obesity Is Found to Gain Its Hold in Earliest Years

docs.abstract: Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine shows that obesity gains its hold in a child's early years; research involving more than 7,000 children finds that a third of those who were overweight in kindergarten were obese by eighth grade, and almost every child who was very obese remained that way; findings may reshape approaches to combating the nation's obesity epidemic.
docs.snippet: Experts say the results of a major new study may reshape approaches to combating the nation’s obesity epidemic, suggesting that efforts must start much earlier and focus more on the children at greatest risk.

docs.lead_paragraph: The measure calls for cuts in food stamps, affecting more than 800,000 households, and in some subsidies for farmers.

headline.main: House Approves Farm Bill, Ending a 2-Year Impasse
headline.print_headline: House Approves Farm Bill, Ending a 2-Year Impasse

docs.abstract: House of Representatives passes bill authorizing nearly $1 trillion in spending on farm subsidies and nutrition programs, setting the stage for final passage of a new five-year farm bill that has been stalled for more than two years; bill includes cuts to food stamps, income caps on farm subsidies and a price support program for dairy farmers.
docs.snippet: The measure calls for cuts in food stamps, affecting more than 800,000 households, and in some subsidies for farmers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Syrian government criticized Congress’s approval of support for the rebels, and the United Nations mediator decided not to continue talks in the afternoon.

headline.main: Syrian Talks Disrupted by Congress’s Approval of Aid to Rebels
headline.print_headline: Syrian Talks Disrupted by Congress’s Approval of Aid to Rebels

docs.abstract: Syrian government and opposition clash during peace talks as government sharply criticizes decision by United States Congress to approve continued support for rebels; outburst leads to suspension of afternoon talks.
docs.snippet: The Syrian government criticized Congress’s approval of support for the rebels, and the United Nations mediator decided not to continue talks in the afternoon.
